entry.summary: The only place where the smartest and hottest sex bloggers are featured under one roof every month.

entry.title: Supporting from the Front
entry.summary: And this is a huge part of our lives. Perhaps even the largest. I make the big decisions, I have the big responsibility, and I'm held accountable for all of it from her. I drag Eiren behind me like the servent of some regal Queen because, well, the Queen doesn't pull herself.

entry.title: I hate the "One Size Fits All" approach
entry.summary: Fuck, the point I want to get to in this post is this: If you assume that one size fits all for every single relationship, about every single part of it, you're just living in the wrong. Relationships are a fluid, changing environment. What works for some people will never work for others and vice-versa.

entry.title: Relationship In Peril, Part 3: Being Stronger
entry.summary: She never thought I'd be the person to say any of this to her. Well, it turns out I am, and once it did she expected that I'd turn into the type of person who'd want to be away from her. Well, it turns out that I'm not.

entry.title: Relationship In Peril, Part 2: Why
entry.summary: At the heart of all of this, though, right smack in the middle of the good and bad questions that I was asking myself, that I was asking other people... was a simple, a small, and an alone "Why?"

entry.title: Relationship In Peril, Part 1: No One Worse
entry.summary: Now, I'll spare you the sudden horror that overcame Eiren. I'll spare you the utter, abject pain that shot through Eiren's mind the moment this sentence left my throat, to my lips, to her ears, and say this instead: There is no one worse than me in this moment.

entry.summary: The only place where the smartest and hottest sex bloggers are featured under one roof every month.

entry.title: Wires, Boxes, and Order
entry.summary: I believe that the shared feeling of satisfaction from giving and receiving a level of order is directly connected to how we think and live our lives.

entry.title: Disabilities & Submission, Part 2: I Say No
entry.summary: My most important function in our relationship isn't my ability for compassion, it isn't my trying to wake up a little earlier each day to bring her coffee, and it especially isn't my ability to make her happy. It's my ability to say "No, Eiren."

entry.title: How bloggers changed my life
entry.summary: All of them, in their own special way, changed the way I was living my life and helped me develop myself into who I am now.

entry.title: Shattering Fire
entry.summary: I just don't know what path I'm going to take right now. I have options, so many options, but they're all dependent on so many things.

entry.title: Elust #83
entry.summary: The only place where the smartest and hottest sex bloggers are featured under one roof every month.

entry.title: Lose yourself to the music
entry.summary: I've never felt more submissive to her than I do right now in my life, doing the things that I fundamentally feel aren't submissive at all, because it has allowed me to feel like I'm taking her needs into consideration before mine.

entry.title: Dirty Little Secrets
entry.summary: For all Eiren knew, I was an established, well paid, attractive, moderately intelligent 22 year old who spoke sweet things to her and - for the first time in her life - made her feel genuinely happy.
